Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: BethS921
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 night stay. The rooms are up to date, very clean and have lovely ammenities. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we felt like family. The staff lead by Aldo was without exception extremely friendly and helpful. Upon arrival, they were outside on the front steps to greet us, help with luggage and take us up to our rooms. Upon departure there were hugs, kisses and thank yous with promises to return from everyone. The staff was happy to make dinner reservations, give advice, call for taxis and really anything that you needed. The location is amazing. On a quiet street just 1/2 block from the top of the Spanish Steps. There were 2 cafes in the square at the top of street that were very good and we stopped in everyday for our pre dinner cockatails and people watching. The waiters greeted us every time like old friends and could not have been nicer. Hotel Gregoriana is walking distance to everything and the fact that it is on a quiet street but not far from all that Rome has to offer is a real bonus. We were very pleased with our experience at Gregoriana and would definitely stay here when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great room”
Reviews.Author: Vandelina
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, just next to the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of almost everything that one would want to visit in Rome, could not have been better. A very well kept hotel, service of a high standard and rooms are welcoming and kept very clean. Bathroom was spotless. Breakfast was a very nice, especially cappuccino : ). It was a perfect city break . The staff is warm,friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn M
Reviews.Content: After reading exceptional reviews about the Hotel Gregoriana my husband and I decided to stay there.To say we were disappointed is an understatement.Upon our arrival we were given no information about what the hotel had to offer.The price we paid for our 5 day stay was ridiculously high considering the lack of facilities available. We found the staff quite unhelpful and on our last morning we were told no one was available to give us breakfast despite the fact breakfast was supposed to be available from 7-10am.(We didn't leave the hotel until 7.30). Admittedly, the rooms were clean and very modern but the hotel is definitely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “The most gorgeous place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Meag12
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying in the Hotel Gregoriana and it is lovely. The service is second to none. It is lovely to return to a place where they know who you are always provide excellent service. It is truly a great art deco experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be maybe?”
Reviews.Author: denboy69
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night at Hotel Gregoriana and did not enjoy my stay. I arrived at the hotel late afternoon and only had a short time to change to meet friends for dinner. I had a bath first thing, and afterward....the plug wouldnt come out of the drain. I called downstairs, and someone came to see it and told me that eventually the water would drain and the plug could be pryed out. Next, I looked around the room for an Iron to press a shirt for dinner. The man at the desk (there was nobobdy else working in the hotel) said that the cleaning staff had already left the hotel and there was no Iron. When I persisted, he called the manager on the phone and the manager basically laughed and said there was no services at that time of night (This was 5:30 in the afternoon on a Sat) Just the week before My crew and I stayed at The Bailey's Hotel in Rome and they are the best kept secret in Rome. The Bailey's Hotel is much cheaper than the Gregoriana and in a great location. The only thing the Gregoriana has going for it is the proximity to the Spanish Steps. Maybe it was a good hotel in the past....but obviously things have changed.

Reviews.Title: “Still a gem”
Reviews.Author: jessdds
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at the Gregoriana for years. It is still as wonderful as I remember. They have renovated since I was in Rome last. We stayed in the apartment for 4 days to start our honeymoon. Aldo, as always, is wonderful. You can't beat the location. The beds are comfy and the room modern. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was a joy to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: NYC928
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect - on a small/quiet street right near the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of almost anything that one would want to visit in Rome. Also nearby, was the underground which made excursions outside the city convenient as well. The rooms were delightfully decorated and immaculately clean, and the bathrooms were very nice/up-to-date. Breakfast, consisting of an assortment of breads and tea/coffee (eggs etc. were available for an extra charge) was served in a lower level breakfast room until 10 A.M. Aldo and the rest of the hotel staff were friendly, welcoming, and helpful. I would return to this hotel on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: sfboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our children (15 & 17) after having last stayed here in 1987. We loved it then and we loved it now. The location is superb--1/2 block from the top of the spanish steps, 5 minutes to trevi, 15 minutes to the Pantheon--although on a beautiful and quiet residential street. The roo ms, albeit small (no desk or sitting are--only 2 small chairs) are comfortable and well appointed with nice bathrooms. The service was magnificant - Aldo makes you feel at home. If you are looking for a "grand" hotel, this is not the place for you--no restaurant, no room service, no business center, no lobby to speak of, smallish rooms. If you are looking for a comfortable place to stay, run by warm people in the center of town this can't be beat. The value for money is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: caz1950
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gregoriana was a great find. It is in an ideal location, at the top of the Spanish Steps, with easy walking to many of the sights. If at the end of the day you are too tired to walk up the Spanish Steps, you can return to the hotel via gradually sloping streets that come in at the bottom end of Gregoriana St. We even walked to Vatican City on a Wednesday to be there in time for the Papal audience. Breakfast is served in a small room and is basic continental. You can have other things at a price. Aldo, the Concierge is a total delight. The rooms are small but very nicely furnished and very comfortable. We can't think of any negatives in relation to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, pleasant, great location”
Reviews.Author: Artemus_Gordon
Reviews.Content: On a quiet unassuming street, very close to the Spanish steps. Excellent location from which to explore Rome. Rooms are small, but outfitted nicely and exceptionally clean. Staff is very pleasant. Nice little breakfast room for a quick bite in the morning. Internet firewall will not let you download mail to Outlook. Ethernet high-speed.

Reviews.Title: “Still my Favorite Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shozgirl
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel many times on business but this was our honeymoon and I couldnt imagine anywhere else. Aldo is still there and very helpful in all possible ways. The location is perfect..near the Spanish Steps but above the din and quiet. Taxis are available close by but walking is easy as well. We had a fantastic time in Rome and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable it felt like our own little apt in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ZenIng
Reviews.Content: Id would deffinitely stay at the Hotel Gregoriana again ! A fantastic ,small ,very personal hotel, with all the comforts I could possibly want. The whole staff at the Gregoriana, esp Aldo and Sandro were incredibly hospitible, and accomodating. The location was absolutely ideal for our daily explorations of the city, with an easy return for a hot shower and then back out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Susivatkain
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated near the Spanish Steps, so You can walk to all major sights. Breakfast was quite modest. Staff is very helpful. Rooms are not bad but dont expect nothing special. Our room was silent.

Reviews.Title: “All good at Gregoriana”
Reviews.Author: windsurfergirl
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location, very quiet. About a block away from the top of the Spanish Steps (you can use the elevator in the Spagna metro station and avoid all but a few steps if needed). Nothing better than taking newspaper down to Spanish Steps in the morning and enjoying a great view over old town. Being so close to metro station is also wonderfully convenient. As mentioned in other reviews the staff is wonderful. Aldo, the manager, in particular was most delightful. Having stayed in Rome multiple times I would happily stat at the Gregoriana again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steph44w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first part of our trip to Italy for our 1 year anniversary. We arrived early in the morning on April 26th. The hotel kept our bags and gave us breakfast until our room was ready a few hours later. Breakfast consisted of a basket of rolls, crussants, and cookies with different spreads. Coffee, tea, juice. We also saw someone eatting an egg one morning, so I guess you can request that too. Aldo and Sandro were very nice and helped us out with any questions we had. The hotel is 4 or 5 floors I believe. There is an elevator, but it is small. We had a room facing the street. It was very quiet even though it was 1 block from the top of the Spanish Steps. I loved how you could open the shutters and take in some of Rome. The bathroom was complete with a shower tub, however the glass only covered part of the shower, so we got water on the floor a couple of times. There is a hairdryer in the room, although not that great. Aldo let me borrow a converter to use because for some reason mine wouldn't work. The bed was comfy and the room had a small flat pannel tv. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Gregoriana and would reccommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyG1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Gregoriana in May 2007 and would definitely return. The hotel is perfectly located 1 block from the Spanish steps and is an easy walk to tons of great shopping and restaurants. The staff was super friendly and accomodating. We had a 3rd guest meeting us there for the final 2 nights of our stay, and the staff made sure we received an extra bed and pillows. The room was charming, clean, and had a wonderful balcony complete with a table for 2. The staff had excellent restaurant recommendations and the hotel contributed to one of the best weekends of my life. Great memories of that balcony...

Reviews.Title: “Still Love the Gregoriana”
Reviews.Author: oreo_8
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at Gregoriana and it continues to be my favorite. I had friends traveling with me and they agreed with me about the location, comfort, cleanliness, and Aldo. Our luggage was lost on the way to Rome. Aldo did his best to help us find it, to no avail. When we decided to leave Rome early, he was very understanding and did not charge us for the unused room nights. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: elleMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gregoriana is as good as others on this site have said it is; the staff - led by Aldo - are very friendly, efficient and welcoming; the location is superb (at the top of the Spanish Steps) and the rooms - although small - are very, very attractive. The hotel has been recently refurbished: the single room I had had a parquetry floor, a comfortable bed with a beautiful parquetry bedhead and lovely pictures on the wall - all connected to a kind of 1940's-1950's retro kind of theme, and all immaculately clean and even pretty. Beautiful heavy fabric curtains - and a window that looked out onto the street. Via Gregoriana is a small street that is one of two that leads away from the top of the Spanish Steps; the other one has one of those hugely expensive, swanky hotels. This street has no other hotels at all and, thus, at night there is virtually no noise at all; I did not hear another noise at night from other guests, either - and, so, if you want to stay in a place where people are quietly well-heeled without being painful or inconsiderate, this place will suit. Breakfast is not a great event - a little basket of pastries, toast with condiments, etc. and coffee/tea but, in a sense, the whole of Rome is 5 minutes walk away and, so, if you want something else, you can go and get it. But for peace and quiet, cleanliness, friendliness and price - this is a great little hotel. I will happily return there for my next trip to Rome. In fact, when I was checking out, I was charged less than I was quoted when I booked the room; now, how often does that happen?

Reviews.Title: “Will be going back soon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at the top of the Spanish Steps close to everything. Rooms have been remodeled and are beautiful. Ask for 1st floor overlooking courtyard. Aldo and all staff will bend over backwards to find what you need in hotel or in Rome. We paid by credit card and made reservations over the phone. Can't wait to return and will ONLY stay at Hotel Gregoriana!

Reviews.Title: “My Rome home!!”
Reviews.Author: hoolio26
Reviews.Content: So the hotel is small and Italians like to smoke which means you might have to put a towel under your door occasionally if you are a sensitive non-smoker like myself, but honestly, I have stayed in a lot of hotels around the world, some really fancy and Hotel Gregoriana rates with the best. Why, when some of the rooms are small, the breakfast is oooookaaaay (but hey, its included and delivered to your room) and the smoking thing? Because Aldo, Marcello and co make you feel so safe, comfortable and cared for in a big city. The location is unbelievable, in the thick of things but quiet and the rates are even more unbelievable for Rome. The new decor is really charming (art deco, simply and stylish) the towels are excellent (there are towel warmers too), beds are comfy, linen crisp, there is CNN, and Aldo really knows Rome. Just dont get your washing done... some things you only do once. Ouch!! I was at the Gregoriana for four days at the beginning of my Italian adventure, then four days at the end and the final stint truly felt like a homecoming. They even upgraded me. Just regards that location again,if you dont fancy the mayhem of the Spanish Steps, consider the fact that the Gregoriana is down the hill slightly and away from the action enough for sleeping. The Barberini Metro is very nearby, the Pantheon, Trevi fountain and a plethora of other monuments a walk (I walked to the Vatican several times, it took a while but ay, what a walk!) and it is an easy return for a siesta then out again. Loved it. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and stylish”
Reviews.Author: bolognababe
Reviews.Content: you have to stay here. a stones throw from the Spanish Steps you just can't get a hotel at this price any closer to the trendiest part of Rome. It is pricey though. The staff were by far the friendliest I have ever encountered anywhere which is a boon. Its also up the road from the Hassler which gives you a little glow knowing you are staying close to where celebs stay when in Rome! The breakfast is good. Some may be put off by the decoration. Its sort of art deco which will date almost immediately so I would be dubious of going back in the next ten years. The marble floors are excellent so maybe not as the quality of the fittings is superb. Time will tell but as of now, book it and visit the exceptional wine bar two minutes away opposite the Hassler.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gregoriana was sugested to us by a cousin of ours who lives in Milano and when he and his wife go to Rome have always loved to stay at The Gregoriana.- This year the hotel had a complete face lift and the 12 room hotel, perfectly situated on top of the Spanish Steps in Rome turned into a beautiful art deco style bed and breakfast.- The rooms are not huge, but VERY confortable; so are the bathrooms.- The staff is very acomodating,helpful and polite.- Everything is spotless.- Breakfast is served in your room, you let the desk manager know when you come back the night before the time you would like your breakfast served and WHAT you would like to have.- Are we staying at The Gregoriana again? YES WE ARE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked, but with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: BWeissman
Reviews.Content: Location- great; at top of Spanish Steps near the Hassler. Very clean room and bath, and breakfast (average, but large) is brought to your door. Daytime guy, Aldo, is great, and will help with anything you need. Nighttime guy often not at desk. Try NOT to get a room facing the street when you reserve. Security is OK due to good location, but the Spanish Steps on Saturday night are EXTREMELY NOISY. I could not sleep that night. Try to get room facing elsewhere. Otherwise, it's fine for the money and location. Other reviewer is correct that lobby looks a little down at the heels, but the rest of the decor is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location! Okay hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Great Staff! Rooms are okay but the plumbing was noisy. No internet access. Cash or checks only. Reseration had to be by fax.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value compared to the other hotels in the neighborhood. The clean and attractive room had a small private balcony and a decent-sized bathroom. Unfortunately there was no rooftop breakfast area, which seems to be the norm among the competition. When I was there in May 2003 I paid with a credit card. They offered a convenient and reasonably priced car service to the airport, and let me charge that as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zephyrman37
Reviews.Content: I think this is a GREAT hotel. What is better than walking out your door in the morning and being at the TOP of the Spanish Steops? THis is a tiny, well run hotel with a great staff and very good prices..who cares if you have to pay cash? THe Hotel hassler across the street is US $550 per night. As far as it being run down, it was VERY nice when i was there recently.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gregoriana
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gregoriana 18, 00187 Rome, Italy
